review: Works fine. Does not get local channels or real time TV. However an indoor antena should get your local stations. Check to see if Netflix, Hulu or your antena gets your "have to have" shows before severing ties with your provider, if that is your intention. Nice feature allows you to stop the show your watching and resume it where you left off later. Most of my tv watching is when I go to bed so works out great. Can see on your tv what is on your Ipad. Bit of a lag doing it that way. If your getting it to sever ties, it is a change to get used to. Switching your tv from one source to the other to watch from the antena or apple tv and the change of the menu. No big deal.
author: Amazon Customer

review: I have an iPad 4th gen and bought this to stream my HD movies I have downloaded from iTunes.........using the HDMI connection to the TV and the toslink optical cable to my Onkyo receiver I get a fantastic home theater experience....was super easy to hook up and connect to my wireless network.......I can stream from my iPhone4s and my iPod touch 3rd gen as well.......If I use my HP laptop and open iTunes I can stream from my homeshare and play my music too.

review: I love this device. It lets me AirPlay everything from my laptop, my phone and my tablet. It is very easy to set up with your Wifi. I have it hooked up via HDMI to my plasma tv and have it outputting sound via an optical cable to my surround sound. The reason I have the optical is so I don't have to turn the tv on to airplay music. I just turn on my surround sound and airplay music to it and then I can do chores while jamming out. My surround sound has sleep functionality so I can leave it playing when I go to sleep and it will turn off. It can access YouTube, Podcasts, movie trailers, Hulu Plus and so much more. The only thing missing from it is a browser, like Safari. I highly recommend this device to Apple users.
